  warning = FALSE, 
  message = FALSE, 
  error=FALSE, 
  comment = "#>",
  fig.align = 'center', 
  fig.width = 12, 
  fig.height = 11, 
  fig.show = 'hold', 
  fig.retina = 5,
  cache = FALSE
)

## Installing **biplotEZ**

```{r eval=FALSE, echo=TRUE}
# Install from GitHub
library(devtools)
install_github("MuViSU/biplotEZ_beta")
#check this
library(biplotEZ)
#check this
library(biplotEZ_beta)

# Getting help                 
help(package="biplotEZ")
```

## Step 1: **biplot()**

This is the data preparation step: centering (TRUE), scaling (FALSE), group identification prepare the data and perform the required computations before the biplot construction. 
```{r, echo = FALSE, eval = TRUE}
args(biplot)
```
::: nonincremental
-   [data]{style="font-family: 'Courier New'"}     A dataframe or matrix containing all variables the user wants to analyse

-   [group.aes]{style="font-family: 'Courier New'"}  Variable from the data to be used as a grouping variable

-   [center]{style="font-family: 'Courier New'"}   TRUE or FALSE

-   [scaled]{style="font-family: 'Courier New'"}    TRUE or FALSE

-   [Title]{style="font-family: 'Courier New'"}     Title of the biplot to be rendered
:::

## Step 2
::: nonincremental
-   All other functions will follow with a pipe ( \|\> )

-   Use the preferred biplot: PCA(), CVA() - available in current version

-   Now a number of formatting changes can be made by calling approproriate functions. 
:::
